channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Lack of immunity means China is vulnerable to another wave of coronavirus, top adviser warns
item.description: China still faces the "big challenge" of a potential second wave of Covid-19 infections, the country's top respiratory authority has warned, with the lack of immunity among the community a serious concern as the race to develop a vaccine continues.

item.title: The coronavirus exposed US reliance on India for generic drugs. That supply chain all hinges on China
item.description: Sarah Thebarge, a 41-year-old physician assistant living in San Francisco, takes a pill every day to treat her lupus, a chronic condition that causes unbearable joint pain, fatigue and fainting spells.

item.title: The latest on the coronavirus from around the world
State Department inspector general becomes the latest watchdog fired by Trump
The privacy intrusions of 9/11 may pale compared with what's coming
US coronavirus deaths to surpass 100,000 by June 1, CDC director says
Mitt Romney calls Trump's IG firings 'a threat to accountable democracy'
item.description: Republican Sen. Mitt Romney on Saturday denounced President Donald Trump's firings of internal government oversight officials, calling it a "threat to accountable democracy."

item.title: Millennials are facing another once-in-a-generation economic disaster
The striking difference between Trump and Fauci at briefing
item.description: President Donald Trump explains why his medical experts are wearing masks but he is not at a White House coronavirus briefing.

item.title: Taiwan's success in fighting coronavirus has bolstered its global standing. This has infuriated Beijing
How China is trying to control the Covid-19 narrative
item.description: The narrative around the coronavirus can be complicated. Now experts say governments are deliberately deepening the confusion.

item.title: Emptied out by Covid-19, Italy's canal city plots ways to keep crowds of tourists from ever returning
item.description: A few days before Italy is set to lift restrictions across much of the country after being locked down since March 10, the streets of Venice are starting to spring back to life.

item.title: Spain reports lowest daily deaths from Covid-19 since mid-March
item.description: Spanish health authorities reported the lowest daily increase in coronavirus deaths since mid-March on Saturday, as the number of new cases continues to slow down.

item.title: Dozens of surrogacy babies stranded by coronavirus lockdown in Ukraine
Protesters harass local reporter during a reopening rally
item.description: News 12 Long Island reporter Kevin Vesey was covering a reopening when protesters harassed and insulted him, and some invaded his personal space while refusing to wear a mask.

item.title: Cafe tells customers to wear pool noodles to enforce social distancing
item.description: A cafe in Germany has celebrated its grand reopening to customers after lockdown by handing out pool noodles to maintain social distancing.

item.title: Tourist arrested in Hawaii after posting beach pictures on Instagram
item.description: A tourist from New York was arrested in Hawaii after he posted beach pictures on Instagram when he was supposed to be in quarantine.

item.title: Spanish island: Germans can start visiting in June
item.description: Spain's Mallorca island in the Mediterranean plans to welcome a limited number of Germans and other travelers in late June in a "pilot project" to restart tourism that has been halted due to coronavirus, Francina Armengol, the Regional President of the Balearic Islands said Thursday.

item.title: Man alone at sea for 3 months emerges to a changed world
item.description: After spending months alone at sea, Canadian sailor Bill Norrie arrived in Christchurch, New Zealand, to find the world completely changed by the coronavirus pandemic. CNN affiliate TVNZ reports.

item.title: Ikea's instructions for building the best pillow forts are what every parent needs right now
item.description: After what feels like a lifetime in quarantine and isolation, parents may be running out of ideas to keep kids entertained.

item.title: Preschools and childcare might reopen soon. Should you send your kid?
item.description: Last week I received an email from my younger son's preschool.

item.title: Lineker 'nervously excited' about football return
item.description: While he is known for his goalscoring exploits on the pitch -- serving England and the likes of Tottenham and Barcelona with distinction -- and off it, becoming a top-notch broadcaster, the former footballer Gary Lineker famously once came up with one of the most oft-used quotes about his sport: "Football is a simple game. Twenty-two men chase a ball for 90 minutes and at the end, the Germans always win."

item.title: Questions surround Mexico's reported Covid-19 death toll
item.description: Mexico has announced plans to reopen the country even as the reported number of coronavirus cases and deaths have been called into question. CNN's Matt Rivers reports

item.title: Border town caught in bizarre, uneven lockdown
item.description: Like so many small business owners, Monic van der Krogt has been hit hard by the coronavirus. The terrace of her cafe and beer garden in this small Belgian town sits empty.

item.title: Husband ties off umbilical cord with face mask after wife gives birth in parking lot
item.description: A Kentucky woman gave birth steps away from a hospital entrance assisted by her husband, who tied off the umbilical cord with a protective face mask.

item.title: French language authorities answer: What gender is 'Covid?'
item.description: For months, the people of France have faced an nigme.

item.title: Denmark's Noma restaurant turns into burger bar
What used to be a 5-hour trip now takes an entire day. This is why
item.description: A location-tracking wristband, mandatory testing upon arrival, one-time hotel entry key cards. CNN's Will Ripley shows us Hong Kong's new strict protocols for travelers arriving from abroad.

item.title: Edvard Munch's masterpiece The Scream is fading. New research has found out why
item.description: Over the last few decades, an unseen enemy has been degrading The Scream. The famous painting by Edvard Munch represents human anxiety and anguish and feels especially relevant during these uncertain times.

item.title: Two Sikh doctors shaved their beards, a pillar of their religion, to treat Covid-19 patients
item.description: Two Canadian doctors of the Sikh faith have made the difficult decision to shave off their beards -- a pillar of their faith -- to continue treating Covid-19 patients.

item.title: Meet the scientist working on a radical new vaccine
item.description: Scientists in London are working to develop a radical new type of vaccine in the effort to combat Covid-19. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports.

item.title: Trapped in lockdown, she was stabbed in the eye
item.description: Seconds after Veronica opened her eyes in the hospital, she knew who had put her there. Her body ached; her head throbbed.

item.title: This iconic casino's never locked it doors. Until now.
item.description: CNN's Kyung Lah speaks with the CEO of Caesars Entertainment Tony Rodio about how the pandemic has halted operations at the iconic Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, and how the hotel and casino plans to reopen once restrictions are eased.

item.title: Quarantine bringing out creativity for millions on TikTok
item.description: CNN's Max Foster shows how people are creatively using TikTok to lip-sync and dance their way out of boredom during the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Samuel Eto'o is celebrated for much more than football in his hometown
item.description: It seemed like a typical day in the New Bell neighborhood, a historic district in Cameroon's economic capital of Douala. Motorcycle taxis hummed through the streets, construction workers pounded away at steel and cement, and street vendors worked hard to sell their products. But everything seemed to stop when a white luxury SUV pulled up, and a face recognizable to everyone in this neighborhood emerged.

item.title: Mystery behind the construction of earliest known temple revealed
item.description: Researchers have discovered part of the mystery behind the construction of the earliest known temple in human history.

item.title: Dear Grandma, read this before you visit the little ones
item.description: Dear Grandma,

item.title: 'Beating hearts' of these pulsating stars create music to astronomers' ears
item.description: Stars may appear bright to us on Earth, but peering inside their hearts is a little more elusive. Star data from NASA's planet-hunting TESS mission has helped an international team of scientists detect patterns in 60 pulsating stars.

item.title: Baby elephant born at the Houston Zoo survives emergency surgery
item.description: It's a boy!

item.title: Will audiences go back to movie theaters after the pandemic ends?
item.description: More and more movies once destined for the big screen are going on-demand while theaters are closed due to the pandemic. Here's what will and will not change about moviegoing because of Covid-19.

item.title: Prestigious British flower show goes virtual
item.description: Horticultural enthusiasts will be able to take a virtual tour of award-winning designers' gardens when Britain's famous Chelsea Flower Show goes online later this month for the first time in its history.

item.title: Mom makes a wild contraption so grandma can hug kids
item.description: Kids hug grandma through plastic. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on a hugging contraption.

item.title: Mary-Kate Olsen files for divorce from Olivier Sarkozy, emergency petition denied
item.description: Mary-Kate Olsen has filed for divorce from her husband of almost five years, Olivier Sarkozy.

item.title: This store owner has crammed 12,000 house plants into her home to keep business afloat lockdown
item.description: When 29-year-old Kerri Notman closed her plant and gift store just before the coronavirus lockdown, she didn't expect to spend the next two months surrounded by 12,000 plants in her own home as she fought to keep her business afloat online during the pandemic.

item.title: Katy Perry strips off to reveal her baby bump in new 'Daisies' video
item.description: Katy Perry has released a dreamy music video ahead of her newest studio album -- and in it, she strips off to reveal her nude baby bump.

item.title: Covid-19 latest: Faulty tests, underreported deaths, deliberate misinformation
item.description: That reassuring test result might be a false negative. The number of dead could be much higher. The reopening likely won't be what you imagined.

item.title: Cornered by the coronavirus, Trump returns to a familiar strategy: Attack Obama
Dangerous consequences of Trump purge
item.description: President Donald Trump survived impeachment, but in the midst of a pandemic, he is still exacting his revenge.

item.title: Taiwan's coronavirus success angers China
item.description: While many governments struggled to contain the spread of coronavirus, Taiwan appeared to have it largely under control.

item.title: The return of elite football?
item.description: It wasn't soccer as we usually know it but games were finally played again on Saturday in Germany, bringing high-profile sporting competition back during the coronavirus pandemic.
